  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38967].
  {panel}

It seems that the login page URL have gotten slightly longer than before

As an example, in Confluence 5.4.1 the URL looks like this when you try to access the login screen of Confluence with the URL http://localhost:8092 it will change to :
http://localhost:8092/login.action?os_destination=%2Findex.action

In the latest Confluence release, we are seeing something like the following when we access the Base URL :
http://localhost:8102/login.action?os_destination=%2Findex.action&permissionViolation=true

You will notice that there is a extra parameter permissionViolation=true which seems to be hardcoded into our source code.

It will great if we could remove that parameter to make the URL shorter.
fields.summary: Shorten the base URL when accessing login page

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38963].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When updating a Confluence space permissions In IE 11 the following error is raised:
{quote}
The following error(s) occurred:
•Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{quote}

h3. Environment
- Windows 8.1 pro
- IE 11
-- tested on multiple updates of IE 11 Most recent version tested: {{11.0.900617937}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Space permissions
# Edit permissions
# Attempt to add or remove any permissions
# Save

h3. Expected Results
- Permissions updated

h3. Actual Results
A User or group will be added with no permissions set if new user is being added but no permissions can be changed

The error pops up in UI:
{code}
The following error(s) occurred:
•Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{code}

Multiple errors in JS console error in IE developer tools relating to:
- {{File: doeditdefaultspacepermissions.action}}
- Noting IE Code has disabled caching linking to MS article on *Back navigation caching*
-- {{http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=291337}}
- See Attached Screenshot for full errors

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome or firefox latest stable version
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Space Permissions with IE 11

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38952].
  {panel}

This is a feature request to add the option to modify the content of the sidebar globally, as the user can do inside the space administration option for Confluence. 

When using the Default Global theme, in each space through *Space Tools > Configure Sidebar*, you have the option to change the navigation displayed for the users, by choosing the Navigation Display options, Shortcuts and content to be displayed. This could be applied globally, so all the spaces would be using the same configuration.

A situation to be used as example, would be that the user is doing a transition from the Documentation Theme to the new Default theme, but, the *Child Pages* option in the sidebar will still be needed. 

This request could be related to the current plans for new Confluence versions, as [this Task|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38256] to remove the Documentation theme.
fields.summary: Option to Modify the Sidebar Globally in Default Theme

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38915].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When the service desk agents group is deleted from User Management in Cloud, it's not deleted in Confluence and no new Confluence users can login.

We are also noticing in some cases when group seems to have been deleted without service desk ever being enabled, users may not be aware that groups have been deleted but will see the symptom that newly created confluence users can't login. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete the service-desk-agents group in user management
# Create a new user in user management
# Give the new user Confluence Application Access
# Log into Confluence as new user

h3. Expected Results
User can login and use confluence

h3. Actual Results
User gets error
{noformat}
Not Permitted
You are not permitted to perform this operation.
{noformat}

The below exception is seen in the confluence log:
{noformat}
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "cwd_group" violates foreign key constraint "fk_group_attr_id_group_id" on table "cwd_group_attribute"
Detail: Key (id)=( <some ID number> ) is still referenced from table "cwd_group_attribute".
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Log a support request with the Atlassian Cloud Support team, who will need to perform maintenance on Confluence.  This will involve around 20 minutes of down-time for Confluence so please advise when this can be performed when you log the ticket.
fields.summary: When the service desk agents group is deleted from User Management, it's not deleted in Confluence and new users can't access Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38904].
  {panel}

I know this has been [asked|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24088] [before|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27030] and in both situations it was closed as "Won't Fix". But that was in 2011 and 2013.

We are in 2015, now. Markdown support is ubiquitous on the web. It's everywhere. It's even the default markup language used by Stash. 

I also know that there are Confluence plugins to add Markdown support, but currently in the market place, only one of those plugins is compatible with the Cloud hosted Confluence:

!MarketPlaceMarkdown.png|thumbnail!

And this plugin has a major drawback, it requires read access to the Confluence content as it sends it to their servers to be processed.

So, with all that said, can we please have an official markdown support on Confluence Cloud?

Thanks
fields.summary: Markdown support for Confluence

Resolved inline comments cannot be deleted. You have to reopen (unresolve) the comment and then delete. There should be a "Delete" link in the Resolved Comments window so you can delete without having to reopen first. 

To reproduce:
* add an inline comment to a page
* resolve the comment
* view the resolved comment via the page more actions menu - there is no way to delete it but there should be
* reopen the resolved comment
* now you can delete it via the inline comment more actions menu

h3. Summary
Even if the anonymous user has add/delete page and add/delete attachment permissions they are not able to attach files to a new page via the image/link browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow Anonymous users create page and add attachment permissions to space. 
# Log out and access the space as an anonymous user 
# Create new page 
# Try inserting attachments by:
##  Drag and drop files
## Click Insert > Files and Images 

h3. Expected Results
Attachments are uploaded

h3. Actual Results
#  Drag and drop files:
#* Error message is displayed:
{code}
You'll need to ask permission to insert files here.
{code}
# Click Insert > Files and Images 
#* Error message is displayed:
{code}
Error retrieving attachments from Confluence. The server may be unavailable.
{code}
 
h3. Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38867].
  {panel}

Hi,

I work within a large enterprise using JIRA, where only a small set of users also use Confluence. Different R&D groups are expressing interested in using Confluence.  We are curious about best practices, advise, or considerations that Atlassian support can offer as we look into expanding usage of confluence.  For example:

* How does having multiple confluence instances plugged into one JIRA instance impact usability?  Administration? Performance?
* Is there some limit that is recommended?  
* Are there best practices for organizing spaces or handling administration for a large organization that might be available for us to consider?
* Are there licensing cost implications for various instances?

I look forward to feedback.  We have a few meetings planned in the next couple weeks and this input will be important for our discussion.

Thanks,
Linda
fields.summary: What considerations should be made when having multiple Confluence instances?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38863].
  {panel}

h2. Feature Summary

Support Asciidoctor-backed AsciiDoc in:

* the WYSIWYG editor,
* through Stash (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-4769)
* through the API directly. 

The unicorns and rainbows solution I'm looking for here is to:

* Write my docs in AsciiDoc
* Version Control docs files in Stash
* Push directly to a confluence node using a "Publish" button. (OH YEAH)

But I'd honestly just settle for native AsciiDoc (Asciidoctor tooling) support in Stash and the API so I can push easily.

h2. Challenge

For me, the way I"m using the Atlassian solution suite is using Stash and AsciiDoc together with Confluence to achieve that elusive writing Zen. That, and I want to single-source my content as much as possible for reuse among the documents I'm writing, and then push the end result to Confluence as a static page.  

The problem is my Zen is being interrupted when I try to push AsciiDoc into Confluence.

In short: I can't. :(

h2. Attempted Workarounds

As there is no support natively at the moment, I need to use 3rd party Ruby tools to attempt to push content in, but these tools are not really working out (due to enhancements required to these tools - bugs raised).

When that fails, I need to transform my AsciiDoc files using Asciidoctor and then try to push the HTML directly into the code view of the Editing Window. The problem with that is due to the admonition macros and other rich content stuff Confluence uses, the beautiful Foundation styles and eye-pleasing Admonition blocks are changed to the Confluence style, and look amateurish. Which makes me look amateurish as a Technical Writer.

One of my DevOps guys has offered to create a buildbox that houses all the Ruby stuff I need to push static HTML into Confluence and listens on Stash Commit Hooks, but that seems overly complex when it would be better to just support AsciiDoc alongside Markdown.

h2. Final Summary

Most professional TechComms professionals will tell you that separating content from presentation is the way to writing Zen. Probe Technical Writers further and they'll probably start talking about ways they use a VCS to control their documentation and manage content reuse.

AsciiDoc is the type of language that Tech Writers use when they are faced with creating complex douments. Many Markdown syntax items (such as admonitions) are a kludge-fest to get working compared to AsciiDoc, and having to do this make Tech Writers stabby and makes their teeth itch.

Please, help Tech Writers work efficiently and effectively using the Atlassian stack of products in a writing language that supports their advanced writing needs.
fields.summary: Enable AsciiDoc Support In Confluence and through API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38862].
  {panel}

*Problem*

An admin is configuring Confluence to used JIRA server for user management. During the configuration, admin has lock himself/herself out in the screen and received this error message:
!after-move-JIRA-directory-to-the-top-order.png|thumbnail!

By lock out, I meant quite literally shutting the door behind you with the key inside. That can happen easily. In the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+Crowd+or+JIRA+for+User+Management#ConnectingtoCrowdorJIRAforUserManagement-ConnectingConfluencetoJIRAforUserManagement], there is no instruction regarding creating {{confluence-administrators}} group in JIRA as a first step. 

So, once connected and positioned at the top of the directory list, no-one will have access to confluence any longer - not even the default administrator account. The default administrator account is called admin. An account by the same name also exists in JIRA, but that account is not in the {{confluence-administrators}}} group either. Hence you managed to lock yourself out.

Another thing, after log out and login, the admin user do not have {{confluence-administrator}} permission.

*Workaround*
Follow this [guideline|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restore+Passwords+To+Recover+Admin+User+Rights#RestorePasswordsToRecoverAdminUserRights-Step3.PuttheInternalDirectoryinFirstPosition] or upgrade Confluence to 5.8.8 version.

*Suggestions*

Update the documentation and teach user to used the right steps.
fields.summary: Lockout yourself after moved JIRA directory to the first order

h3. Summary
When a page property macro contains an expand macro, if the page is included in a page property report macro the expand macro doesn't function and the content inside the expand macro is always shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert a page properties macro
# Create a table in the page properties macro with a two verticle cells
# Enter "Content" as text in the top cell
# Insert an expand macro in the bottom cell and fill it with some text
# Set a label on the page for use in the page property report macro
# Save the page
# Create another page and insert a page property report macro
# Configure the page property report macro to use the label set on the previously created page
# Preview the page before saving and note the expand macro is rendered correctly
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
Expand macro renders correctly and is expandable\clickable in the page properties report macro.

h3. Actual Results
Macro is rendered as text and is always expanded.
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Expand Macro Doesn't Work Inside the Page Properties Report Macro

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38856].
  {panel}

Not sure if this is a bug or intended functionality but it looks like if a page has multiple *Excerpt* sections, when I use the *Excerpt Include* macro in a different page, I can't choose which excerpt to display.  Instead it just shows the first excerpt.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new page with 2 Excerpt sections
# Create another page and use the Excerpt Include macro
# You will notice that it only allows you to select a page title and you can't drill down to a specific excert
fields.summary: Excerpt Include - Can select only the first excerpt from a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38837].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When there are many child pages on a single page eg: 25000 child pages , the page load time is high approximately 1 minute.
When we disable the child pages by modifying the documentation theme ([as mentioned here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=227416166] ) this load time comes down to under 1 second.

h3. Suggested Solution

There is a similar improvement request here : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5494
However, we can have a new feature in Documentation theme as well as the default theme where only 50 child pages are displayed and if want a full list of child pages we can have a link which will display all the child pages of the page.

For Documentation Theme the child pages appear at the bottom while for the default theme they appear in the sidebar , so this feature should be applicable to both the themes.
fields.summary: Show only 50 child pages when page contain more child pages

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38829].
  {panel}

Since the Office Connector (View File Macro) was replaced with the new _Display Files and Images_ Macro, it would be great to have this new macro to render the file within the page just like the old macro does.

*Example:*
The new Display Files and Images Macro renders like this:
!fileviewer.png|thumbnail!
* To be able to read the content we need to click on it so it opens in full screen mode.

Whereas the PDF Macro (View File Macro) works like this:
!pdfviewer.png|thumbnail!
* Here we can read and navigate the pages without needing to view it in full screen.
fields.summary: Display Files and Images Macro to render the file within the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38828].
  {panel}

Premier clients have raised the request to ease their User Administration pains as they increase their sites to use Confluence Data Center. Currently, there is no easy way to inactivate users in bulk within the the user interface of Confluence. The only methods to do this are through the SOAP API through add-ons such as [Confluence CLI|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cli] or non-marketplace solutions such as [Bulk disable users for JIRA and Confluence|http://www.tieto.com/industries/telecom/tietos-solutions-network-equipment-providers/tietos-solutions-network-equipment-providers-rd-efficiency-excellence/development-platform-service/atlassian-services/atlassian-plugins] which are not Confluence Admin-friendly, but rather require some additional efforts to run correctly, and are prone to error by a Confluence Admin.

The pain point here is that many Premier clients who previously had *unlimited* licenses are now having to police their licensing to fit within the Data Center licensing limits, some are struggling to inactivate thousands of users and other objects which were sync'd across through LDAP sync and now count against their Datacenter license count. 

When moving from 10000 users down to 2000 users, a manual solution is not effective at inactivating users (one at a time). Having to buy a third-party add-on to then spend more money to get to Datacenter with fewer users is a hard sell to a client that is intending to expand their use of Confluence and makes the process painful and should be addressed as this is a major blocker on upgrade and expansion of Data Center.

If we offered a method to paginate through users and set them to inactive through a checkbox on the UI, we could help alleviate the pain of the migration
fields.summary: Manage Users through Admin Interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi Guys,

I received an email from Giles Brunning regarding my concern on having a capability to add an expand macro in inline text: 

For example:
This is a +{color:#59afe1}sample{color}+ text
[hidden image]
This is a sample text

What I'm trying to do is have the option to show/hide an image/text using this macro.

He mentioned that this is not possible at the moment.
Could you create this feature?

Thanks,




 
Appreciate your assistance.
Thanks and regards.
fields.summary: Add Expand Macro capability for inline text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38798].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In Confluence Cloud, when a *JIRA Issues Macro* is used to add an issue in JIRA, the description field is not being rendered properly. As per the documentation on *[JIRA Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/JIRA+Issues+Macro]*:

bq. Formatted fields from JIRA can be displayed in Confluence if you set up a Confluence-to-JIRA application link. Otherwise, such formatted fields will be escaped within the output of the JIRA issues macro.

If the instance has both JIRA and Confluence, the application links are set by default.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Check the *Application Links* between JIRA and Confluence to make sure they are correctly set
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Fill in the header of the page with the title
# In the table enter several example lines in a table as below
# Save the page
# Highlight the first *Summary* entry in the table and click the *Create JIRA issue* symbol above the highlighted words
# At the pop-up, select a _Project_ and _Issue Type_.
# Click the suggestion (i) to _Create 2 issues from this table_
# Click *Create*

{panel:title=Test Table}
|| Summary || Description || 
| Test abc | Test description
* aaa
* bbb
* ccc
* ddd |
| Test abc2 | Test description
* aaa2
* bbb2
* ccc2
* ddd2 |
{panel}

Expected Behaviour:
For the *Description* field in the created JIRA Issues to be rendered properly, in this case with bullet points.

Current Behaviour:
*Description* field data will all be in one line without bullets

h3. *Workaround*
Manually edit the *Description* field to reflect the formatting. However this is very tedious and inconvenient.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not render fields correctly when creating issues from table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence, the *PDF Layout* section under *General > Look & Feel* does specify that it's for Space exports:
!Screen Shot 2015-08-14 at 11.17.24.jpg!

However, the *Global PDF Stylesheet* in the same section does not specify, and only mentions for PDF Export.
!Screen Shot 2015-08-14 at 11.17.14.jpg!

h3. Suggested Solution
Ensure that this is clarified so users do not expect this to work with single page exports, as is specified in the documentation:
[Customise Exports to PDF|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customise+Exports+to+PDF]

{quote}PDF customisation only applies to space exports (not single page exports via Tools > Export to PDF){quote}
fields.summary: Global PDF Stylesheet settings should specify that it affects space exports only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38795].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Administrators sometimes need to [rebuild the ancestor table|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table]. This process has no progress report on the UI, moreover by default it does not log anything.

This is problematic, as in many cases the reverse-proxy used in front of Confluence will timeout the client request, however this does not terminate the java thread processing the rebuild. So problems to tackle here:
- Progress bar on the admin UI to report the status 
-- Preferably putting the task as a one-time scheduled job, so that if the proxy times out, the status can still be monitored
- Log the start and the end of the process
-- Consider logging the percentage of the progress

h4. Workaround
- You can [enable debug logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Logging] for the class {{com.atlassian.confluence.pages.ancestors}}, which then will show the progress with the following format: {noformat}
2015-08-14 10:27:12,883 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-1] [confluence.admin.actions.ConfigureLog4jAction] add New logger [ com.atlassian.confluence.pages.ancestors ] saved
2015-08-14 10:27:30,997 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] clearAncestorsCollectionCache Clearing ancestors cache ...
2015-08-14 10:27:30,998 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] clearAncestorsCollectionCache Ancestors cache cleared.
2015-08-14 10:27:31,000 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Learn the wonders of autoconvert (step 7 of 9)[98305] (1/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,001 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Lay out your page (step 6 of 9)[98306] (2/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,001 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Prettify the page with an image (step 4 of 9)[98307] (3/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,002 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Tell people what you think in a comment (step 8 of 9)[98308] (4/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,002 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Get serious with a table (step 5 of 9)[98309] (5/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,002 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating What is Confluence? (step 1 of 9)[98311] (6/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,003 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating A quick look at the editor (step 2 of 9)[98312] (7/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,003 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Let's edit this page (step 3 of 9)[98313] (8/9)
2015-08-14 10:27:31,003 INFO [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [confluence.pages.ancestors.HibernatePageAncestorManager] rebuild updating Share your page with a team member (step 9 of 9)[98314] (9/9)
{noformat} See: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+enable+Ancestor+table+rebuild+progress+logging]
- You can run the following query to compare the {{CONTENT}} table to the ancestor table, to see if all the entries are represented already. However, on large instances this query may run way too long, so it is not appropriate for progress monitoring in such cases. When all the entries here return {{1}} instead of {{0}}, the process can be considered complete. {code:sql}
SELECT A.ANCESTORID, A.DESCENDENTID, COUNT(A.DESCENDENTID)
FROM CONFANCESTORS A, CONTENT B
WHERE B.CONTENTID = A.DESCENDENTID
GROUP BY A.ANCESTORID, A.DESCENDENTID
ORDER BY 3 DESC;{code}
fields.summary: Progress report for rebuilding the ancestor table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38791].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Issue link feature in JIRA does not load Confluence blog post.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a blog in Confluence
# Insert any JIRA issue 
# Save
# View the issue that you have inserted the blog post and you will see that the *Issue Link* showing the error *Page Failed to load*, as you can see in the below image:

h3. Summary

Users experience a silent error when trying to copy a page. No dialog is shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy page
# Try to save the copy

h3. Expected Results
Page saves as normal.

h3. Actual Results
Page does not save, editor stays open. No errors displayed or logged.

h3.Workaround
Remove personal labels (including favourites) from the page prior to copying.

Use this query to find out which users have favorited this page:
{code:sql}
confluence=# select u.username from label l, content_label c, user_mapping u where c.labelid = l.labelid and u.user_key = l.owner and c.contentid = (select contentid from content join spaces on content.spaceid = spaces.spaceid where content.contenttype = 'PAGE' and content.title = '<PAGE TITLE>' and spaces.spacekey = '<SPACE KEY>');
{code}
fields.summary: Attempting to copy a page in Confluence fails silently

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38780].
  {panel}

*Documentation link:* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Site

*Problem*
Currently this is the warning we have in the page:
{quote}
(!) CAUTION: Restoring a backup of an entire confluence site will:

* Wipe out all Confluence content in the database. Please ensure that your database is backed up before you start.
* Log you out after the restoration process. Please make sure you know the login details contained in the data that you are about to restore.
{quote}

Which should include the warning that the base-url is automatically changed to the base-url which the backup comes from.

*Example*
If the current instance uses {{http://myconfluence.com}} as base-url and the instance that the backup was generated from uses {{http://localhost:8090/conf}}, after importing the backup in my current instance the base-url will be changed from {{http://myconfluence.com}} to {{http://localhost:8090/conf}}.

*Fix*
Having said that, the best _fix_ would be to include it in the warning:
{quote}
(!) CAUTION: Restoring a backup of an entire confluence site will:

* Wipe out all Confluence content in the database. Please ensure that your database is backed up before you start.
* Log you out after the restoration process. Please make sure you know the login details contained in the data that you are about to restore.
* Change the base-url of the Confluence instance to the base-url which the backup was generated from.
{quote}
fields.summary: Restoring a Site documentation does not warn about the base url change

h3. Summary
Users cannot type double byte characters (i.e. Japanese, Korean, Chinese) in Section in Confluence pages through IE11 (see the attached).

h3. Environment
* IE11 (the problem did not happen in Firefox and Chrome)
* Microsoft IME (the problem did not happen in [Google Japanese IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/])

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install vanilla Confluence 5.8.8
# Create a space and click "Create" button to create a page
# In page edit mode, create a section in body field
# Try to type double byte characters (i.e. Japanese, Korean, Chinese)

h3. Expected Results
Users can type double byte characters. Specifically 'あ' will be shown when typing 'a' when using Japanese IME.

h3. Actual Results
Users cannot type double byte characters. Specifically 'a' will be shown when typing 'a' even when using Japanese IME.

No exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

h3. Notes
- Users cannot type double characters but they can copy&paste the characters

h3.Workaround
- Use other browsers than IE11
- Use other IME than Microsoft IME (i.e. [Google Japanese IME|https://www.google.co.jp/ime/ for Japanese])
fields.summary: Cannot type double byte characters in Section through IE11

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Improvement
Lock the top bar (also incorrectly - in Confluence parlance - referred to by users as menu bar or navigation bar or header) for continuous access to menus, navigation buttons, search field, etc.
h3. Current Status
The top bar is not fixed and thus menus, navigation buttons, etc. are no longer immediately accessible when vertically scrolling to read content. 
h3. Use Case
If I am reading a comment and want to view another page (either simultaneously in another window or separately in another tab) +without losing my current place+, I need direct and constant access to the top bar. Otherwise, by scrolling up or using shortcuts to access the top navigation bar, my current location in the page is lost and I must scroll down again to the previous location.
*Typical example:*
While reading the comments on a page, you find one that you are sure was discussed in a meeting, the notes of which are in another Space. The _Home_ or _Pos1_ key will generally take you back to the top of a page, while the shortcut _GG_ puts the focus in the search field. Unfortunately, all of these cause you to lose your position on the current page. As such, you can not use the top bar components (buttons, search field, etc) to open another browser tab/window without losing the current page position. This is particularly inconvenient for quickly viewing two or more Confluence pages simultaneously.
h3. Related Cases
[CONF-38219] addresses the same issue, but was ambiguously described and taken to be a suggestion for creating a special page template.
[JRA-27758]
JRA-21963
fields.summary: Lock top bar (menu / navigation)

Confluence/JIRA administrators get frustrated, when they need to do the same thing differently in Confluence than in JIRA:
To add an announcement banner in confluence you can do the following things:
* Change the site layout - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+add+a+site-wide+banner
* Install a plugin - https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.atl-announcer-confluence
In JIRA you simply set the corresponding administration option: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+an+Announcement+Banner

It would be best if Confluence provides the same administration option as JIRA (and gets as well the same updates/improvements for that feature).
fields.summary: Add an administration option for announcement banners in Confluence like in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38720].
  {panel}

Ideally there would be some mildly intrusive, perhaps translucent, line running from a comment box to the paragraph it's linked to.   Perhaps the lines would be visible only when the comment box gets moused over.
As comments are mapped at the paragraph level, and as a single paragraph may have multiple comments, this scheme may get tangled quickly

An alternative would be:
* _Based on the fact that the (very) pale blue megaphone icon indicates a paragraph has a comment associated with it._
* each comment box has some unique identifier at its top, say, a serial (index) number.   The # would be displayed about as visibly as the commenter's name.
* either overlay the (very) pale blue megaphone with the comment identifier, or, display the comment identifier associated with the  (v)PBM _when it gets moused-over.)

Here's my use case:
* I'm commenting on a document.
* A lot.
* I made a long comment at para. 5.
* Then I made comments at paras 6, 8, & 9.   Strangely, the para 5 comment continues to float below (further down the page) as I create these new comments, getting further & further away from its home paragraph.
* I edited the para 5 comment to note that it relates to para 5.
* After the change to the para 5 comment, *_it_* now aligns with para 5.   The para 6, 8, & 9 comments, however, remain _above_ the para 5 comment, so now _they_ are super displaced from their relevant texts.
I'm hoping this comment disordering issue has already been addressed.
The issue of easily associating comments with their paragraphs remains, and is particularly painful when many comments are present.

I'm working in Firefox, and I've saved the page in .maff, mhtml and "as complete webpage" formats.   I will attach 1 or all to this ticket, in case it might benefit you.  That's why I'm indicating "Security Level" != "None"
fields.summary: Need some better (more obvious) way to map comments to the para they discuss
